To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.comFrom: bob@...: Tue, 6 Nov 2007 14:43:00 +0000Subject: [samuraihistory] Re:Did any family, clan, or group had green as a primary color?




Greetings/La math duibhCiamar a tha sibhI know that the Taira colour was a darker green when at their height of power.And also the Takeda had a very similar if not same shade of green during their greatest era.I have seen the colours associated with clan mons for years upon years of research into Japanese culture and history, particularly medieval history but cannot remember the sources - but if you patiently search for them you should not have too much difficulty locating them.Dia beannaichGu'n ro' math agaibhMar sin leibhSigned Bob Thompson~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~God so loved the world that He gave His Only Begotten Son.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re:Did any family, clan, or group had green as a primary color?
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings/La math duibh Ciamar a tha sibh I know that the Taira colour was a darker green when at their height of power. And also the Takeda had a very similar
messages.messageBody:
Greetings/La math duibh
Ciamar a tha sibh

I know that the Taira colour was a darker green when at their height of power.
And also the Takeda had a very similar if not same shade of green during their greatest era.

I have seen the colours associated with clan mons for years upon years of research into Japanese culture and history, particularly medieval history but cannot remember the sources - but if you patiently search for them you should not have too much difficulty locating them.

Dia beannaich
Gu'n ro' math agaibh
Mar sin leibh



Signed
Bob Thompson

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
God so loved the world that He gave His Only Begotten Son.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
